steps.description: GDB non-insulated → rooftop condensation risk → suggest GDMI
steps.query: I need a GDB 600x600 FZ housing for rooftop installation. Airflow 3000 m³/h.
steps.response_text: the gdb filter housing is not suitable for outdoor rooftop installation due to condensation risk on non-insulated metal surfaces. outdoor environments require double-wall insulated housings to maintain the surface above the dew point. i recommend the gdmi modulfilterskåp, which is specifically designed for outdoor use. to finalize the configuration, i need two details: what is the minimum expected ambient temperature at the installation site? high humidity reduces carbon adsorption efficiency. keep relative humidity below 70% for optimal performance.

assertions.name: detect_gdb
assertions.actual: the gdb filter housing is not suitable for outdoor rooftop installation due to condensation risk on non-insulated metal surfaces. outdoor environments require double-wall insulated housings to maintain the surface above the dew point. i recommend the gdmi modulfilterskåp, which is specifically desig

assertions.name: no_length_question

assertions.actual: the gdb filter housing is not suitable for outdoor rooftop installation due to condensation risk on non-insulated metal surfaces. outdoor environments require double-wall insulated housings to maintain the surface above the dew point. i recommend the gdmi modulfilterskåp, which is specifically desig

steps.description: GDMI 600x600 AZ capacity 3400 ≥ 3000 → OK, ask length (600 or 850)
steps.query: Switch to GDMI. Use Aluzink (AZ) material instead of FZ.
steps.response_text: for the rooftop project, we're switching to the gdmi housing. unfortunately, fz material is not available for gdmi housings. given the outdoor/rooftop environment, which exposes the system to outdoor condensation and high humidity, i recommend using aluzink (az) or zinkmagnesium (zm) for better corrosion resistance. to finalize the configuration, i need two details: what is the minimum expected ambient temperature at the installation site?
